current_contact.agency: San Bernardino County Sheriff Department - Coroner Division

case_body_condition: Not recognizable - Partial skeletal parts only
case_address_found_1: 2.75 miles W/O Hwy 395, .5 miles N/O Duncan Rd.
case_circumstances: The skeletal remains of Jane Doe #06-87 were found in a shallow grave in the desert near Phelan, CA.  She is estimated to be a White female adult, probably between 30 and 50 (dental age: 35-45), and stood between 5'1" and 5'4", with course straight brown hair (with gray).  She is described as "robust and muscular."  Her toenails had been painted with red polish and her teeth were in excellent allignment (extensive dental work).  Identity may only be established with dental X-rays (on file) and DNA (refer to CODIS #BK-04-000734).  Possible comparison with "smiling photographs" (showing teeth).
case_head_hair: Brown, medium lenght (10cm), course and streight.  With gray.  Cut at unequal lengths.
fingerprints: Fingerprint information is currently not available
dental: Dental information / charting is available and entered
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
